alert.note: Alert for Caldwell (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Louisiana, including the following parishes, Caldwell, Grant, La Salle and Winn. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 529 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jena, Olla, Midway, Urania, Tullos, Georgetown, Zenoria, Standard, Burlington, Rochelle and Spaulding.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
